rooms.Name: The Seaport of Ithaka
rooms.Description:
A gentle breeze coming from the wine-dark sea pulls you toward the seaport of
Ithaka.  Seagulls circle above you crying out, and the islanders stand at the
water's edge to offer their greetings and farewells to the visitors that come
and go throughout the day.  Men on the docks are preparing a ship for travel
to some distant land.

rooms.Name: On the Docks of Ithaka
rooms.Description:
There is much commotion at the docks of Ithaka today, as there was a war
declared at Troy, and the town's men are preparing to set sail for battle.
There are several black ships grounded here while their stores are
replenished before they set sail. The waves roll in and rock the ships,
making the wood creek as it rubs against the dock.

rooms.Name: The Coast of Ithaka
rooms.Description:
The shoreline of Ithaka changes with each rolling tide.  The pebble beach is
lined with trees that move with the wind.  You catch a glimpse of two larger
trees that separate to give way for a foot path leading up a hill.  At the
top of the hill overlooking the port is Odysseus' manor.

rooms.Name: Along the Beach
rooms.Description:
There are many towns people carrying out their business today on this pebble
beach.  The town's cryer wails about the bloodshead to be had in the land of
the Trojan in the coming days, and the port is anchored with a fleet of ships
preparing to set sail.

rooms.Name: The Coast of Ithaka
rooms.Description:
The seaport glows a radiant orange with the come of a calm day, but not
today. There are baskets, amphori, and sacks full of supplies all in a line
before the dock on this day.  The time calls for a journey to be made.  There
is a large fire roaring for the traveler's hecatomb to be set ablaze, and
libations prepared and set aside while the final preparations are made.

rooms.Name: A Path Along the Sea
rooms.Description:
You stand on a stony road overlooking Ithaka's seaport.  The strong breeze
carries the mist of the water up the rocky edge to where you stand.  Many sea
worthy boats are parked in the harbor rocking with each wave that comes
ashore.  The sight and sound of the waves roll in with perfect harmony.

rooms.Name: Along a Road
rooms.Description:
You travel along a trail, and there are seagulls gliding through the sky in
the near distance.  The seaport is near and you smell seasalt in the breeze.
Lining the trail are olive trees, and above the tops of these trees you have
a glamerous view of the King's Manor.

rooms.Name: The Swineherd's Hut
rooms.Description:
After long days of grazing in the pastures, the swineherd and his men take
shelter here on beds of balsam near the crackling fire.  There is a hut where
the master swineherd sleeps through the night wrapped in heavy blanket cloaks
and sheepskin, while the rest of his men take up the warmth of the fire with
their watch dogs.

rooms.Name: Grazing Fields
rooms.Description:
Lined by olive tree bushes, this paddock is home to the many sheep belonging
to the King of Ithaka.  The grass is short, but plentiful enough to fatten
the animals for the feasting.  At the edge of this plot runs a spring that
trickles water down the hill and feads into the sea.

rooms.Name: On a Path
The Road to Odysseus's Manor
rooms.Description:
Along the stony trail just outside Odysseus's Manor, there is a spring house
where many of the villagers fill their jars of the ice cold spring water.
You can hear children playing in a nearby field, and a beggar is resting on a
large rock by the spring begging for food and clothing.  Before you is a
massive stone wall that surrounds the King's dwelling and hall.

rooms.Name: At the Spring
rooms.Description: coming soon

rooms.Name: In Front of the Manor
rooms.Description:
A great wall stands before you with it's enormous gates.  The surrounding
grounds lead down hill into town and to the harbor.  The view from Odysseus'
Manar is breathtaking.

rooms.Name: Inside the Courtyard of the King's Manor
rooms.Description:
The minstrel sits here playing his harp for the children while they bathe a
puppy in a wash tub, in the middle of the courtyard.  In the distance there
are maidens tending to the various fruit trees.  The gate wall provides good
shade for the residents of the manor in the heat of the day and good
protection from the vagabond's in the dark of the night.

rooms.Name: In the Courtyard
rooms.Description:
The minstrel's song is barely heard over the joyful laughter of the children
as they drench each other in their attempt to give a puppy a bath. This part
of the courtyard has many miniture gardens of flowers outlined with small
rocks.  There is a small stone water pond for the birds, and beautiful berry
bushes that have just begun to blossom.

rooms.Name: The Vineyards
rooms.Description:
The leaves of the grape vines russle in the wind as you pass by rows and rows
of vines.  Because of the dry air, many skins of water are poured on these
grounds daily.  In the distance you hear the sound of someone getting water
from the pump.

rooms.Name: Amoung the Olive Bushes
rooms.Description:
Scattered throughout the drupaceous thickets loaded with all shades of green
and black olives, are large wicker baskets for gathering and storing the
fruit of this land.  The trees are low and hang full of olives ranging from
yellow, green, and black.

rooms.Name: An Entranceway
rooms.Description:
Large square pillars that are painted a pale green give way to the stairway
between the olive thickets, and the olive storage room.  The steps are
constructed of stone and the delicately painted walls tell a story, as the
mural covers the walls throughout the stairway.

rooms.Name: The Olive Room
rooms.Description:
There is a large press in the center of this room that rests atop a vessel
for storing olive oil.  Many baskets of black olives line the painted walls,
and a few branches hang on the walls.  There is a window with it's shutters
open to allow the beams of light fill the room.  The air is thick with the
scent of oil.

rooms.Name: The Wine Cellar
rooms.Description:
The smell of firmented fruit hits you when you enter the cellar.  There are rows
and rows of shelves sporting various vintage wines, and empty skins and jugs
on the table in the middle of the room for transporting the wine from the vat.
The room is kept dark and cold.

rooms.Name: The Maid's Quarters
rooms.Description:
Many straw mats are lined up along the wall with goatskins and wool cloaks
folded up neatly in the corner.  There is a small window to the court yard
where you can hear children's laughter and a dog barking.  The scent of a
roasting animal seeps into the room.

rooms.Name: The Vault
rooms.Description:
The walls of this room display many sorts of weaponry, from shields to
crossbows. Above the entrance way door is where Odysseus' legendary bow
hangs.  He is the only one granted the power to ever string it, as many
others have tried, and failed. It is customary that when visitors call upon
your house, their weapons are put to rest in a safe room while they drink and
feast.

rooms.Name: The Storeroom
rooms.Description:
As you enter this great vault where gold and bronze lay piled along with
chests of clothes, and fragrant oil.  There are jars of earthenware in rows,
holding an old wine, mellow, unmixed, and rare; cool stood the jars against
the wall, kept for whatever day Odysseus, worn by hardships, might come home.

rooms.Name: The King's Manor Hall
rooms.Description:
Just inside the King's manor hall, is a large room with many long heavy
tables for feasting.  The ceiling is high with it's long beams supporting the
balcony where Queen Penelope weaves her loom.  The town's men all gather here
to court her while Odysseus, the King is thought to be away on a journey.
The men are all served good wine and the pick of the swineherd's flock is
roasting in the fire.

rooms.Name: Stairway to the Balcony
rooms.Description:
The stairway is solid marble with an elaborate red carpet lining the steps.
There are torches along the wall to light the way.  The solid banister is
delicately carved with an intricate design and accentuates the curve of the
stairway.

rooms.Name: The Balcony
rooms.Description:
Upon this balcony is where Queen Penelope spent many years weaving her loom
of vast fabric while she awaits her King Odysseus' return from his journey.
The balcony overlooks the great manor hall where many suitors come to bring
Penelope gifts in hopes to tempt her to remarry.  She kept them at bay for
three years, and on the fourth, she was caught unweaving by the candlelight
at night.

rooms.Name: The Master Bedroom
rooms.Description:
An old olive tree grew like a pillar on the building plot for this massive
bedroom suite.  The tree was used as one of the bedposts, and is inlaid with
gold, silver and ivory.  The bed is made of a pliant web of oxhide thongs
that is stretched taught.  The stone walls and roof were built up around the
tree, and a doorway with it's smooth fitted doors mark the entrance.  Along
one of the walls there is an elegant table holding several candles to light
the room.

rooms.Name: Telemakhos's Bedroom
rooms.Description:
This bedroom is lined with strong stone walls that are decorated with
tapestries and has a grand window overlooking the land abroad.  The bedding
is piled with large bed fleece, rugs, and the sheets are of the purest linen.
Under the window is a keepsake chest that is draped with red silk.

rooms.Name: Courtyard South
rooms.Description:
Just inside the courtyard, the manor chambers seem to grow one out of
another. The strong walls of the gate capture the fumes of the mutton
roasting, and echo the minstrel's harp song rippling in the air.

rooms.Name: By the Orchards
rooms.Description:
A gust of wind carries the alarming sound of a raven's cry as you pass
through the courtyard.  The shade trees standing tall beside the elaborately
carved bench seem unaffected by the wind, and you wonder if the gods look
upon you with grace at this hour of the day.

rooms.Name: The Apple Orchards
rooms.Description: look again soon

rooms.Name: A Little House
rooms.Description:
You pass through a lofty doorway constructed of wide smooth ash into an
elaborate house belonging to Laertes, the father to Odysseus.  The walls of
this house are crafted from oak, and have wide bay windows decorated with
rich silken linen.  The hardwood floors are covered with antique rugs, bright
in design.  The openness of this house gives you a warm comforting feeling.

rooms.Name: On the Docks
rooms.Description:
As you step onto the dock, you take one last look at the land of Ithaka, and
it's natural beauty.  The docks are busy with men loading the ships that are
about to set sail for Troy.  The trojan war has taken many lives already, and
the people of Ithaka were asked to help.  The sound of the town's crier
echo's in your thoughs as you are about to set sail.

rooms.Name: Aboard a Sailing Vessel
rooms.Description:
You step on board Odysseus' ship and are ordered to prepare to set sail.  The
stores and libations have already been placed on board and secured in their
place. The black sail is wrapped up tight until the crew rows this giant
vessel out of the harbor. The brisk smell of sea water surrounds you as the
waves come into shore rocking you gently.

rooms.Name: The Seaport of Ithaka
rooms.Description:
As the crew members of this ship cast off, they attempt to refocus their
minds to what lies ahead when they reach their destination.  The shoreline
crawls with Ithacans bidding their farwell to their friends and family
members, hoping to see them again soon.  The men at the oars take on a steady
rhythm, and the wind picks up as the distance between the shore increases.

rooms.Name: The Seaport of Ithaka
rooms.Description:
As the waves crash all around you, the undercurrent from the wine-dark sea
pulls you increasingly further away from the shorline of Ithaka.  The wind
blows steadly out of the northwest carrying thick grey clouds towards the
port that is filled with sailing vessels heading out to sea.

rooms.Name: The Seaport of Ithaka
rooms.Description:
All of the sailing vessels that filled the seaport of Ithaka now make their
way through the mouth of the port and head out to sea.  The wind blows
stronger and fills the large sails.  The water swells and the crests get
larger to remind you that Lord Poseidon rules the waters.  All the men on
Odysseus' ship please the gods with roasted thigh and bittersweet libations
in hopes that they will soon return to the land if Ithaka.

rooms.Name: Out to Sea
rooms.Description:
The sailing vessel with Odysseus and his crew skim the broad back of the wine
dark sea.  The flutist plays a tune while the crew members, with their
bellies full, rest and await the Trojan seaboard.  A visit from the goddess
Athena stirred the heart of Odysseus, and he dwells upon the words she layed
upon his ears.

rooms.Name: Out to Sea
rooms.Description:
The thunderous waves of the wine dark sea crash all around you.  The god who
laps the land in water must be near and toying with you, as he is the ruler
of the water you find yourself in now.  You catch a glimpse of the dark
clouds that have formed above you, and it starts to rain.

rooms.Name: Out to Sea
rooms.Description:
The high fiery winds blow and the surf boils with a thundering crash as the
waves break into high surf tossing the ship.  A stormcloud rounds the peak
ahead and is seemingly never to dissolve.  The deck of the ship becomes
drenched in sea mist, and the crew members pray they've not offended the lord
that rules the sea.

rooms.Name: Out to Sea
rooms.Description:
You travel across the broad back of the sea and draw near to the rocky
seawall where the thunderous waves crash upon the cliffs.  The beaches of
Troy are just around the corner, and many giant sailing vessels line the
shore.  The place where the water meets the land is crawling with men hauling
their supplies to shore, and the wind carries the scent of fire from inland.

rooms.Name: Approaching Troy
rooms.Description:
As you approach Troy, the land unfolds itself through the many layers of rock
formations.  There is a beach area enveloped by giant rocks and surrounded by
huge cliffs.  The beach area is crawling with men and the sound of their
shouts echo in the wind.  The wind and waves seem to calm as you get closer
to the shoreline.

rooms.Name: Pokemon Quest Room
rooms.Description: This is one of the rooms for the Pokemon quest
